title: Converting Percentages to Probabilities
text: Note that in the problem, we note the percent of all Californians that are Latino. Also note, this is the definition of L, the event we are seeking the probability for. Probabilities are proportions between $$0$$ and $$1$$ while percentages are between $$0$$ and $$100$$. To get a probability from a percentage, divide by $$100$$.

title: Determining the Probability P(L)
text: What is P(L), or the percentage of all Californians that are Latino, divided by 100?
